titleStmt.title: Digital Edition of Glaser Abklatsch ID: AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-B125b
AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-B125b

item.term: Early first millennium to the fourth century BC (predominance of Saba)
Fourth to first centuries BC (predominance of Qataban and Hadramawt, and their alliance with Main)
First century BC to early second century AD (alliances between the tribes of the high plateau and the ASA kingdoms)
Late second to late third centuries AD (wars among the Himyar, Saba and Hadramawt)
Fourth to sixth centuries AD (unification of Yemen under Himyarite rule)
It corresponds to the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans with sub-periods I-IV
First sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Third sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans

graphic.desc: By kind permission of British Museum

1.[... ... the vassal of Barān Yuharḥib of Hamdān and Tha-] 2.[wbān ʾAshwa]ʿ and [Hathib and Sa]ʿa[d]shamsum and [their son] 3.Haʿān Waḥiyyān, of the lineage of Ḥaḍirān, have dedicated to 4.their [pa]tron god Taʾlab Riyāmum, Lord of Gudadān, of the to[w]n 5.of Taʾlaqum, this bull (statuette), in gratitude because he de- 6.livered his two servants Thawbā[n] and Saʿadshamsum from the predica- 7.[ment which] they endured in the territory of the town of Taʾlaqum, as well as in that (other) pre- 8.[dica]ment, for he had dispatched Thawbān and Saʿadshamsum when 9.three armed forces [rose] up against them in the plain [in] 10.[Sa]mānum and in Khashbān, and in the territory of their household. And 11.Taʾlab granted them deliverance from all of those armed forces. 12.And they rendered thanks to the power and might of Taʾlab. And 13.(they did so) with gratitude because he saved them from all the wars 14.in which they served their lord Barāg Yuharḥib of the lineage of 15.Hamdān. And may Taʾlab grant them prosperity 16.and hearty crops and the pleasure of their lords 17.of the lineage of Hamdān; and may he protect them from 18.the enmity of any foe. By Taʾlab Riyāmum.

the vassal of Barān Yuharḥib of Hamdān and Tha-
wbān ʾAshwaʿ and Hathib and Saʿadshamsum and their son
Haʿān Waḥiyyān, of the lineage of Ḥaḍirān, have dedicated to
their patron god Taʾlab Riyāmum, Lord of Gudadān, of the town
of Taʾlaqum, this bull statuette, in gratitude because he de-
livered his two servants Thawbān and Saʿadshamsum from the predica-
ment which they endured in the territory of the town of Taʾlaqum, as well as in that other pre-
dicament, for he had dispatched Thawbān and Saʿadshamsum when
three armed forces rose up against them in the plain in
Samānum and in Khashbān, and in the territory of their household. And
Taʾlab granted them deliverance from all of those armed forces.
And they rendered thanks to the power and might of Taʾlab. And
they did so with gratitude because he saved them from all the wars
in which they served their lord Barāg Yuharḥib of the lineage of
Hamdān. And may Taʾlab grant them prosperity
and hearty crops and the pleasure of their lords
of the lineage of Hamdān; and may he protect them from
the enmity of any foe. By Taʾlab Riyāmum.

the vassal of Barān Yuharḥib of Hamdān and Tha-
wbān ʾAshwaʿ and Hathib and Saʿadshamsum and their son
Haʿān Waḥiyyān, of the lineage of Ḥaḍirān, have dedicated to
their patron god Taʾlab Riyāmum, Lord of Gudadān, of the town
of Taʾlaqum, this bull statuette, in gratitude because he de-
livered his two servants Thawbān and Saʿadshamsum from the predica-
ment which they endured in the territory of the town of Taʾlaqum, as well as in that other pre-
dicament, for he had dispatched Thawbān and Saʿadshamsum when
three armed forces rose up against them in the plain in
Samānum and in Khashbān, and in the territory of their household. And
Taʾlab granted them deliverance from all of those armed forces.
And they rendered thanks to the power and might of Taʾlab. And
they did so with gratitude because he saved them from all the wars
in which they served their lord Barāg Yuharḥib of the lineage of
Hamdān. And may Taʾlab grant them prosperity
and hearty crops and the pleasure of their lords
of the lineage of Hamdān; and may he protect them from
the enmity of any foe. By Taʾlab Riyāmum.

the vassal of Barān Yuharḥib of Hamdān and Tha-
wbān ʾAshwaʿ and Hathib and Saʿadshamsum and their son
Haʿān Waḥiyyān, of the lineage of Ḥaḍirān, have dedicated to
their patron god Taʾlab Riyāmum, Lord of Gudadān, of the town
of Taʾlaqum, this bull statuette, in gratitude because he de-
livered his two servants Thawbān and Saʿadshamsum from the predica-
ment which they endured in the territory of the town of Taʾlaqum, as well as in that other pre-
dicament, for he had dispatched Thawbān and Saʿadshamsum when
three armed forces rose up against them in the plain in
Samānum and in Khashbān, and in the territory of their household. And
Taʾlab granted them deliverance from all of those armed forces.
And they rendered thanks to the power and might of Taʾlab. And
they did so with gratitude because he saved them from all the wars
in which they served their lord Barāg Yuharḥib of the lineage of
Hamdān. And may Taʾlab grant them prosperity
and hearty crops and the pleasure of their lords
of the lineage of Hamdān; and may he protect them from
the enmity of any foe. By Taʾlab Riyāmum.
